dialog.speaker: Carlos
dialog.spanish: Compré un carro nuevo. Es muy bonito.
dialog.english: I bought a new car. It's very pretty.

dialog.speaker: María
dialog.spanish: ¿De qué color es?
dialog.english: What color is it?

dialog.speaker: Carlos
dialog.spanish: Es azul. Y es un carro pequeño.
dialog.english: It's blue. And it's a small car.

dialog.speaker: María
dialog.spanish: ¡Qué bien! Mi carro es viejo y grande, y es de color negro.
dialog.english: How nice! My car is old and big, and it's black.

dialog.speaker: Carlos
dialog.spanish: Mi carro azul es más rápido que tu carro negro.
dialog.english: My blue car is faster than your black car.

questions.question: ¿De qué color es el carro de Carlos?

dialog.speaker: Ana
dialog.spanish: ¿Quién es tu hermano?
dialog.english: Who is your brother?

dialog.speaker: Luis
dialog.spanish: Mi hermano es el chico alto con la camiseta amarilla.
dialog.english: My brother is the tall boy with the yellow t-shirt.

dialog.speaker: Ana
dialog.spanish: Ah, lo veo. ¿Y quién es la chica baja?
dialog.english: Ah, I see him. And who is the short girl?

dialog.speaker: Luis
dialog.spanish: Ella es mi amiga Elena. Tiene el pelo largo y negro.
dialog.english: She is my friend Elena. She has long, black hair.

dialog.speaker: Ana
dialog.spanish: Es muy bonita.
dialog.english: She is very pretty.

questions.question: ¿Qué color tiene la camiseta del hermano?

dialog.speaker: Juan
dialog.spanish: ¿Cuál libro es más interesante, el rojo o el gris?
dialog.english: Which book is more interesting, the red one or the gray one?

dialog.speaker: Marta
dialog.spanish: El libro rojo es viejo, pero es muy interesante.
dialog.english: The red book is old, but it is very interesting.

dialog.speaker: Juan
dialog.spanish: ¿Y el libro gris?
dialog.english: And the gray book?

dialog.speaker: Marta
dialog.spanish: Es un libro nuevo, pero es difícil de leer. El viejo es mejor.
dialog.english: It is a new book, but it is difficult to read. The old one is better.

dialog.speaker: Juan
dialog.spanish: Entonces leeré el libro rojo.
dialog.english: Then I will read the red book.

dialog.speaker: Roberto
dialog.spanish: Ayer fui a un parque. Era un parque muy grande.
dialog.english: Yesterday I went to a park. It was a very big park.

dialog.speaker: Silvia
dialog.spanish: ¿Y cómo era? ¿Había árboles grandes?
dialog.english: And what was it like? Were there big trees?

dialog.speaker: Roberto
dialog.spanish: Sí, había muchos árboles verdes y un lago azul. ¡Muy bonito!
dialog.english: Yes, there were many green trees and a blue lake. Very pretty!

dialog.speaker: Silvia
dialog.spanish: Suena a un lugar tranquilo.
dialog.english: It sounds like a quiet place.

dialog.speaker: Roberto
dialog.spanish: Sí, era un lugar tranquilo y limpio.
dialog.english: Yes, it was a quiet and clean place.

dialog.speaker: David
dialog.spanish: Busco mis llaves. No las encuentro.
dialog.english: I am looking for my keys. I can't find them.

dialog.speaker: Laura
dialog.spanish: ¿Cómo son?
dialog.english: What are they like?

dialog.speaker: David
dialog.spanish: Son pequeñas y de color gris.
dialog.english: They are small and gray.

dialog.speaker: Laura
dialog.spanish: ¿Están en la mesa pequeña?
dialog.english: Are they on the small table?

dialog.speaker: David
dialog.spanish: No, no están ahí. ¡Las encontré! Estaban en la silla azul.
dialog.english: No, they are not there. I found them! They were on the blue chair.

sentences.spanish: Tengo dos mascotas, un perro y un gato.
sentences.english: I have two pets, a dog and a cat.

sentences.spanish: Mi perro se llama Max. Es grande, negro y un poco viejo.
sentences.english: My dog is named Max. He is big, black, and a little old.

sentences.spanish: Es un perro muy feliz y amigable. Le gusta correr en el jardín.
sentences.english: He is a very happy and friendly dog. He likes to run in the garden.

sentences.spanish: Mi gato se llama Luna. Es pequeño, blanco y tiene ojos verdes.
sentences.english: My cat is named Luna. She is small, white, and has green eyes.

sentences.spanish: Luna es una gata tranquila y un poco tímida.
sentences.english: Luna is a calm and a little shy cat.

sentences.spanish: A ella le gusta dormir en una silla pequeña y limpia.
sentences.english: She likes to sleep in a small, clean chair.

sentences.spanish: Max y Luna son diferentes, pero los dos son muy bonitos.
sentences.english: Max and Luna are different, but both are very pretty.

sentences.spanish: Visité una ciudad vieja el verano pasado.
sentences.english: I visited an old city last summer.

sentences.spanish: Las calles eran estrechas y los edificios eran altos.
sentences.english: The streets were narrow and the buildings were tall.

sentences.spanish: Había muchas casas viejas y bonitas de diferentes colores.
sentences.english: There were many old and pretty houses of different colors.

sentences.spanish: Vi una casa roja con una puerta azul.
sentences.english: I saw a red house with a blue door.

sentences.spanish: También visité un museo. Era un edificio muy grande.
sentences.english: I also visited a museum. It was a very big building.

sentences.spanish: Dentro, había muchos cuadros y esculturas famosas.
sentences.english: Inside, there were many famous paintings and sculptures.

sentences.spanish: La ciudad era interesante y me gustó mucho.
sentences.english: The city was interesting and I liked it a lot.

sentences.spanish: Fui a la tienda de ropa para comprar un regalo.
sentences.english: I went to the clothing store to buy a gift.

sentences.spanish: Mi amigo quiere una camisa nueva. Su color favorito es el verde.
sentences.english: My friend wants a new shirt. His favorite color is green.

sentences.spanish: Vi una camisa verde muy bonita, pero era demasiado grande.
sentences.english: I saw a very pretty green shirt, but it was too big.

sentences.spanish: Busqué otra camisa. Encontré una camisa azul, pero no era el color que él quería.
sentences.english: I looked for another shirt. I found a blue shirt, but it was not the color he wanted.

sentences.spanish: Finalmente, encontré una camisa verde. Era una camisa pequeña y limpia.
sentences.english: Finally, I found a green shirt. It was a small and clean shirt.

sentences.spanish: El pantalón de mi amigo es largo, pero su camisa es corta.
sentences.english: My friend's pants are long, but his shirt is short.

sentences.spanish: El regalo es perfecto.
sentences.english: The gift is perfect.
